posts.description: On Feb 1 and Feb 8 and Feb 15 Sundays, my weekly posts precisely predicted the weekly momentums: the volatile Feb 3, the consolidation, levels, and the rebound on Feb 6;
Every time you look at tools such as put/call deltas, ratios, or even monitor changes in order flow (e.g., the ratio between selling and buying volume), you get lagging data.
Well, eleven months have passed since I launched my Substack blog—after, in 2024, you had been asking me for more than half a year to create a private place where I could share my analyses.
As I mentioned in this morning’s chat, Witkoff is currently in the Kremlin.

Here is the big summary post about all these events that most of you is lost in, and the expectations.
Speed profile with intraday vol breakdown

Investors still don’t trust Trump, and momentum remains well inside the rangebound zone I marked. Yesterday, a flurry of TSLA calls boosted the tape and some manipulative trades tried to jack up sentiment on a few headlines—but remember: no real progress was made.
A very important shift in sentiment is on the way!
Literally at the bottom on Nov20, I was a cautious bull, and warned everybody to don’t be bearish there (even shared my call buyings).
Dear viewers and readers, it looks like we won’t have to wander far for our daily dose of excitement today either!

Now that we’re beyond the 20-day window during which the market hit the level (last year April’s lows) below which I had anticipated volatility selling and consolidation, realized volatility fell from 42.29% to 27.67%.

After calling the April selloff and the downside target in advance, I began writing more and more about a so-called ‘hidden QE’—which, by May, I started referring to as the ‘Bessent put’: a concealed support mechanism designed to sustain artificial growth, primarily via equity–yield correlation dynamics.
Good morning to everyone who loves the whiff of that fresh-mattered morning NFP print.
SPX is trading at 5987.3 when I’m writing these lines…
We have a lot of Fed speakers and PMI (thursday) and VIX expo this coming week.
As everybody already knows that the coming Fed cut will be a hawkish cut due to the checkmate situation, volatility keeps being managed for this week and day to day.
What on earth is going on in these markets?
